lifeEvents: Lost a parent at young age

dialogueTree.characterInternalMonologue: Here we go again, another stranger trying to sell me something. I hope they see the value in what I truly need. Can't they sense I'm just trying to find my way in this world? I wish I could feel a bit more connected right now.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: This person seems eager. I wonder what they're selling, but I hope it's something meaningful.

options.text: I believe this pen can help you express your thoughts beautifully.
options.characterResponse: Wow, that's really thoughtful. I do love writing my songs and poetry. Let me see it!

options.text: This pen is the best on the market, you won't regret it.
options.characterResponse: Best on the market? I’m not sure what that even means to me. I need something that speaks to my heart.

options.text: You should just buy this pen because everyone else does.
options.characterResponse: That feels really impersonal. I don't care what everyone else thinks.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They seem to want to connect, but I need to feel that they understand me.

options.text: This pen can be a tool for your creativity and healing.
options.characterResponse: You really get it! Creativity is so important to me right now.

options.text: I just want to make a sale, it's a great pen.
options.characterResponse: It sounds like you're more interested in the sale than me. That’s a bit off-putting.

options.text: Just think of it as an investment; you can resell it later.
options.characterResponse: An investment? That feels so cold and transactional. I’m not here for that.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I hope they keep this conversation meaningful. I want to feel understood.

options.text: Imagine writing your thoughts down and sharing them with others. This pen can help with that.
options.characterResponse: That sounds beautiful. Sharing my thoughts is something I really need to do.

options.text: This pen has a fancy design; isn't that nice?
options.characterResponse: I guess, but it’s not about looks for me. I want something with significance.

options.text: Honestly, you should just trust me. This pen is amazing.
options.characterResponse: Trust? I barely know you. That feels forced.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They have to show me that they care about my needs, not just the sale.

options.text: This pen can be a part of your journey towards healing and expression.
options.characterResponse: That resonates with me. I do want to heal and express myself.

options.text: It's just a pen; you can find another one anywhere.
options.characterResponse: That doesn’t make me feel valued. I want something that feels special.

options.text: If you don't buy it, you're missing out.
options.characterResponse: That feels manipulative. I’m not a fan of that approach.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I’m starting to feel a connection here. I hope they can seal the deal.

options.text: This pen can hold your thoughts and dreams. It can help you find your purpose.
options.characterResponse: You know, I think I really need this. I'll take it.

options.text: I have a lot of other customers, but you'll love this pen.
options.characterResponse: That sounds dismissive. I want to feel important, not just another customer.

options.text: You should just buy it and see what happens.
options.characterResponse: That feels too vague. I need something more meaningful.

dialogueTree.successEnding: Sage smiles warmly, feeling a spark of inspiration, and accepts the pen, grateful for the connection.
dialogueTree.failureEnding: Sage shakes their head and walks away, feeling misunderstood and disconnected from the conversation.
